intro: Hesperantha quadrangula, commonly known as the four-angled hebes, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its square stems and clusters of small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its compact growth habit and prolonged blooming period. Hesperantha quadrangula is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
